content:
By default, a FlexCard loops through records returned from its data source. The FlexCard displays the list of records in containers called cards.

Improve the performance on rerendered elements when a FlexCard with repeating records updates. Only rerender the affected card record in the FlexCard component by entering a unique Render Key that identifies it. The FlexCard LWC uses the key to find which element in the DOM, the rendered HTML, to update.

To display data that doesn't need repeating, disable the Repeat Records feature. For example, disable the feature to display a Chart element that displays data from multiple Accounts or a Datatable element that lists Account Cases.

Repeatable Modes

This table displays how the Repeat Records feature works for an Active State and a Blank Card State when records are available and not available:

ENABLED?

RECORDS AVAILABLE?

ACTIVE STATE
Blank Card State

Yes (default)
Yes
Show a card for each available record.
Hidden
When a condition results in no records to show, this state is hidden.

Yes (default)
No
Hidden
Show one card, such as to show an action link to create a record.

No
Yes
Show one card with all available records inside it. For example, to display a Datatable, List, Chart, or a container, such as a Custom LWC or child Flex Card that uses the data source provided by its container.
Hidden

To disable Record Looping on a FlexCard, To improve Performance of Repeated Records on a FlexCard, Disable Record Looping on a FlexCard, Improve Performance of Repeated Records on a FlexCard
title: Improving Performance and Displaying Data in FlexCards
